result.execSummary:
The defendant Malisia A. Marek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bond was applied towards the costs.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days after plea and sentencing to be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Malisia A. Marek in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charge of bail jumping.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Statement by the attorneys, victim and defendant.  Court orders withheld sentence - probation for 18 months with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA and comply with treatment recommendations at agent's discretion; absolute sobriety; counseling as deemed appropriate; letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days after plea and sentencing.  - rt

by Malisia A. Marek
Initial appearance at 03-11-2016 11:15 am

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Malisia Marek appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 cash bond; booking no possession consumption of alcohol.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court ordered clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in Case No. 15CF30.  Next court date is March 8, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances.
